OptiCommPy
  • Welcome to OptiCommPy's documentation!
  • View page source

Welcome to OptiCommPy's documentation!

OptiCommPy is a Python-based framework to simulate systems, subsystems, and components of fiber optic communication systems, for educational and research purposes.

Note

This project is under active development.

Reference

  • Available features
  • Installation
  • Requirements/Dependencies

Package documentation

  • Digital Communications Utilities
    • Digital modulation utilities (optic.comm.modulation)
    • Metrics for signal and performance characterization (optic.comm.metrics)
    • OFDM utilities (optic.comm.ofdm)
  • Digital Signal Processing (DSP)
    • Core digital signal processing utilities (optic.dsp.core)
    • DSP algorithms for equalization (optic.dsp.equalization)
    • DSP algorithms for carrier phase and frequency recovery (optic.dsp.carrierRecovery)
  • Physical Models
    • Models for optical devices (optic.models.devices)
    • Models for fiber optic channels (optic.models.channels)
    • Models for optical amplifiers (optic.models.amplification)
    • Functions adapted to run with GPU (CuPy) processing (optic.models.modelsGPU)
    • Advanced models for optical transmitters (optic.models.tx)
  • Plot Utilities
    • constHist
    • eyediagram
    • pconst
    • plotPSD
